intro: Sabicea apocynacea, commonly known as the yellow-flowered sabicea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature.
